page.title: 12S.P.A.R.E. V S.E.B.
page.content: 1985's argument in Tadley is a battle between the Southern Electricity Board and S.P.A.R.E.(Stop Pylons Across our Rural Enviroment).The S.E.B. want to put up pylons between Newbury and Bramley passing through Tadley.Many people have objected to this and formed the group S.P.A.R.E. The S.E.B. have to supply electricity in the cheapest possible way. The background to the present problem is that in 1974 it was estimated by S.E.B. that Newbury would be needing more electricity at the rate of 6% a year.This was to come from Bramley Frith.Pylons were decided as the method and local land owners were approached to sign wayleaves to give permission for pylons to be put on their land.Most agreed,some objected.
